page.title: 07PEAT EXTRACTION:CROWLE MOOR.
page.content: {Peat}has been extracted from {Crowle Moors}now for many centuries; but only quite recently has it been the centre of a thriving industry. Two companies presently extract peat from the Moors. One is a relatively small concern run by Mr. Ken Crow; the other is part of the large Fisons corporation. The{peat}is dug from the ground using large mechanical diggers; it is then loaded onto lorries. Ken Crow then has his peat sent by road to his processing plant some two miles away, at Medge Hall. Fisons peat is sent to the Fisons processing plant, in the North Western area of this block, using a{small guage railway. {
